titleInfo.title: 'File V/14 Messooda bint Shaool Aboo Mazika, Jewish girl perverted into Muhammadan by -'

physicalDescription.extent: This file is arranged approximately in chronological order.

Foliation: The foliation system starts at the front cover and continues through to the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, circled and found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between Percy Gordon Loch, the British Political Agent at Bahrain; Percy Zachariah Cox, Chief Political Officer at Baghdad; the Chief Rabbi of Baghdad; Yoosif Ziloof [Yūsuf Zilūf]; and Shaikh Rāshid bin Muḥammad Āl Khalīfah. Also contained within the file are various interview notes.These papers concern a request by the Chief Rabbi of Baghdad for the British authorities to recover a young Iraqi Jewish woman named Massooda bint Shaool Aboo Mazika [Mas‘ūdah bint Shāhūl Abū Mazīkah] who had journeyed to Bahrain, converted to Islam and was living in the house of Shaikh Rāshid, the step brother of the wife of Sheikh ‘Īsá bin ‘Alī Āl Khalīfah. Included in the file is a copy of the letter of the Chief Rabbi (ff. 2-3), correspondence with the agent of the Baghdad Jewish Community in Bahrain (f. 6) and with Shaikh Rāshid (ff. 9-10).
